snippet: When LeBron James bowled over the wife of the professional golfer Jason Day, it was a reminder that there are no guarantees when it comes to huge athletes playing a fast-moving game in a confined space.
abstract: Cleveland Cavaliers forward LeBron James injures Ellie Day, wife of golfer Jason Day, when he leapfrogs row of fans sitting courtside after chasing loose ball, knocking Dau out of her chair; Day, who suffers mild concussion, defends James, saying courtside seats carry inherent risk.
lead_paragraph: When LeBron James bowled over the wife of the professional golfer Jason Day, it was a reminder that there are no guarantees when it comes to huge athletes playing a fast-moving game in a confined space.

headline.main: Courtside Seats Don’t Carry a Warning Label, but the Risk Is Real
headline.print_headline: Courtside Hit Is Likened to a ‘Minor Car Accident’
